segment.source: File Handling
segment.target: File Handling

segment.source: File Handling
segment.target: File Handling

segment.source: File Handling
segment.target: File Handling

segment.source: The File Handling assessment provides an automated way to exercise common file operations and capture metrics.
segment.target: The File Handling assessment provides an automated way to exercise common file operations and capture metrics.

segment.source: This assessment measures durations and throughput while copying, moving, compressing, extracting, and deleting files and folders on your computer.
segment.target: This assessment measures durations and throughput while copying, moving, compressing, extracting, and deleting files and folders on your computer.

segment.source: The results help you understand how well the computer performs during these operations.
segment.target: The results help you understand how well the computer performs during these operations.

segment.source: For more information about the results, see Results for the File Handling Assessment.
segment.target: For more information about the results, see Results for the File Handling Assessment.

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: The File Handling assessment is only supported on English (United States) versions of Windows.
segment.target: The File Handling assessment is only supported on English (United States) versions of Windows.

segment.source: Running this assessment on non-English (United States) versions of Windows might prompt you with an error and the assessment might stop running.
segment.target: Running this assessment on non-English (United States) versions of Windows might prompt you with an error and the assessment might stop running.

segment.source: The following graphic illustrates the assessment process.
segment.target: The following graphic illustrates the assessment process.

segment.source: workflow graphic for file handling
segment.target: workflow graphic for file handling

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: System Requirements
segment.target: System Requirements

segment.source: Workloads
segment.target: Workloads

segment.source: Settings
segment.target: Settings

segment.source: System Requirements
segment.target: System Requirements

segment.source: The first-run help tips in Windows 8.1 can negatively affect assessment results.
segment.target: The first-run help tips in Windows 8.1 can negatively affect assessment results.

segment.source: To disable these, run the following command from an elevated command prompt, and reboot the computer:
segment.target: To disable these, run the following command from an elevated command prompt, and reboot the computer:

segment.source: Run this assessment only while the desktop is full screen.
segment.target: Run this assessment only while the desktop is full screen.

segment.source: Do not run this assessment if you have another Windows Store app opened side-by-side with the desktop.
segment.target: Do not run this assessment if you have another Windows Store app opened side-by-side with the desktop.

segment.source: When running this assessment on Windows 8.1, make sure the Collect Analysis Trace setting is unchecked when assessing expected battery life.
segment.target: When running this assessment on Windows 8.1, make sure the Collect Analysis Trace setting is unchecked when assessing expected battery life.

segment.source: When checked, this option will produce an incorrect estimation.
segment.target: When checked, this option will produce an incorrect estimation.

segment.source: Enable analysis trace collection only when you need additional information to investigate other energy-related problems.
segment.target: Enable analysis trace collection only when you need additional information to investigate other energy-related problems.

segment.source: You can run this assessment on the following operating systems:
segment.target: You can run this assessment on the following operating systems:

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Supported architectures include x86-based, x64-based, and ARM-based systems.
segment.target: Supported architectures include x86-based, x64-based, and ARM-based systems.

segment.source: The assessment isn't supported for use on virtual machines.
segment.target: The assessment isn't supported for use on virtual machines.

segment.source: You can run this assessment on Windows RT in either of the following ways:
segment.target: You can run this assessment on Windows RT in either of the following ways:

segment.source: Package the assessment job in the Windows Assessment Console and then run it on Windows RT.
segment.target: Package the assessment job in the Windows Assessment Console and then run it on Windows RT.

segment.source: For more information, see Package a job and run it on another computer.
segment.target: For more information, see Package a job and run it on another computer.

segment.source: Use Windows Assessment Services to run assessments on Windows RT.
segment.target: Use Windows Assessment Services to run assessments on Windows RT.

segment.source: For more information, see Windows Assessment Services.
segment.target: For more information, see Windows Assessment Services.

segment.source: Workloads
segment.target: Workloads

segment.source: A workload is a set of automated tasks that simulate user activity in a predefined, repeatable manner.
segment.target: A workload is a set of automated tasks that simulate user activity in a predefined, repeatable manner.

segment.source: This assessment measures durations and throughput for the following workloads, and it captures the metrics in the results file.
segment.target: This assessment measures durations and throughput for the following workloads, and it captures the metrics in the results file.

segment.source: Programmatic Workloads.
segment.target: Programmatic Workloads.

segment.source: These workloads use the API to perform file functions.
segment.target: These workloads use the API to perform file functions.

segment.source: These workloads measure only the underlying file functionality.
segment.target: These workloads measure only the underlying file functionality.

segment.source: File operations include copypg, movepg, and deletepg.
segment.target: File operations include copypg, movepg, and deletepg.

segment.source: Scripted Workloads.
segment.target: Scripted Workloads.

segment.source: These workloads simulate user activity in File Explorer on a computer running Windows 8.
segment.target: These workloads simulate user activity in File Explorer on a computer running Windows 8.

segment.source: File operations include copyuxxs, deleteuxs, moveuxs, and zipuxs.
segment.target: File operations include copyuxxs, deleteuxs, moveuxs, and zipuxs.

segment.source: Scripted workloads can't be used if you're running the assessment on a computer running Windows 7.
segment.target: Scripted workloads can't be used if you're running the assessment on a computer running Windows 7.

segment.source: For more information about choosing a workload, see Settings.
segment.target: For more information about choosing a workload, see Settings.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can also use the File Handling assessment as a workload in an energy-efficiency job.
segment.target: You can also use the File Handling assessment as a workload in an energy-efficiency job.

segment.source: For more information about energy-efficiency jobs, see Create and run an energy efficiency job.
segment.target: For more information about energy-efficiency jobs, see Create and run an energy efficiency job.

segment.source: Settings
segment.target: Settings

segment.source: By default, this assessment uses the recommended settings.
segment.target: By default, this assessment uses the recommended settings.

segment.source: Microsoft defines these settings so that you can compare the results across multiple computer configurations or over time on the same computer.
segment.target: Microsoft defines these settings so that you can compare the results across multiple computer configurations or over time on the same computer.

segment.source: When you review the results, the run information includes metadata that indicates whether the assessment used the recommended settings.
segment.target: When you review the results, the run information includes metadata that indicates whether the assessment used the recommended settings.

segment.source: You can also customize the settings if you want to gather data that's different from what the assessment captures by default.
segment.target: You can also customize the settings if you want to gather data that's different from what the assessment captures by default.

segment.source: However, if you change the default source or destination folders or supply your own files, comparisons may no longer be relevant.
segment.target: However, if you change the default source or destination folders or supply your own files, comparisons may no longer be relevant.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: After you run the assessment, all files in the Recycle Bin may be permanently deleted.
segment.target: After you run the assessment, all files in the Recycle Bin may be permanently deleted.

segment.source: Therefore, before you run the assessment, review any files in the Recycle Bin because they won't be available or restorable after the assessment concludes.
segment.target: Therefore, before you run the assessment, review any files in the Recycle Bin because they won't be available or restorable after the assessment concludes.

segment.source: The following table describes the assessment settings, recommended values, and alternative values for each setting.
segment.target: The following table describes the assessment settings, recommended values, and alternative values for each setting.

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Use recommended settings
segment.target: Use recommended settings

segment.source: Specifies whether the assessment uses the recommended settings.
segment.target: Specifies whether the assessment uses the recommended settings.

segment.source: By default, this check box is selected.
segment.target: By default, this check box is selected.

segment.source: To change the settings for this assessment, you must first clear this check box.
segment.target: To change the settings for this assessment, you must first clear this check box.

segment.source: Iterations
segment.target: Iterations

segment.source: Specifies the number of times that the assessment runs.
segment.target: Specifies the number of times that the assessment runs.

segment.source: By default, the value is 1.
segment.target: By default, the value is 1.

segment.source: To run the assessment multiple times and average the results, increase this value.
segment.target: To run the assessment multiple times and average the results, increase this value.

segment.source: Source
segment.target: Source

segment.source: Specifies the location that the assessment copies the workload files or folders from.
segment.target: Specifies the location that the assessment copies the workload files or folders from.

segment.source: To specify a location other than the default, enter a path to the source folder in the box.
segment.target: To specify a location other than the default, enter a path to the source folder in the box.

segment.source: The assessment can use multiple computers, external devices and network locations for the Source folder.
segment.target: The assessment can use multiple computers, external devices and network locations for the Source folder.

segment.source: Workloads can be configured to perform file functions in the Source folder alone, or you can specify a Source and Destination folder.
segment.target: Workloads can be configured to perform file functions in the Source folder alone, or you can specify a Source and Destination folder.

segment.source: Destination
segment.target: Destination

segment.source: Specifies the location that the assessment copies the workload files or folders to.
segment.target: Specifies the location that the assessment copies the workload files or folders to.

segment.source: You must have write access to the destination folder.
segment.target: You must have write access to the destination folder.

segment.source: To specify a location other than the default, enter a path to the destination folder in the box.
segment.target: To specify a location other than the default, enter a path to the destination folder in the box.

segment.source: If you provide a different destination folder, the destination folder must be empty before you start the assessment.
segment.target: If you provide a different destination folder, the destination folder must be empty before you start the assessment.

segment.source: Workloads can be configured to perform file functions in the Source folder alone, or you can specify a Source and Destination folder.
segment.target: Workloads can be configured to perform file functions in the Source folder alone, or you can specify a Source and Destination folder.

segment.source: External devices and network locations are supported.
segment.target: External devices and network locations are supported.

segment.source: Enable Reboots
segment.target: Enable Reboots

segment.source: Specifies that the machine will be restarted before every file operation.
segment.target: Specifies that the machine will be restarted before every file operation.

segment.source: Not enabled by default
segment.target: Not enabled by default

segment.source: Use this to ensure a clean system before timing every operation.
segment.target: Use this to ensure a clean system before timing every operation.

segment.source: This is especially useful for testing Anti-virus software behavior.
segment.target: This is especially useful for testing Anti-virus software behavior.

segment.source: Execution Delay
segment.target: Execution Delay

segment.source: Specifies the time is seconds to wait after a reboot before performing the file operation.
segment.target: Specifies the time is seconds to wait after a reboot before performing the file operation.

segment.source: Only available when using the “Enable Reboots” parameter.
segment.target: Only available when using the “Enable Reboots” parameter.

segment.source: The default is 300 seconds.
segment.target: The default is 300 seconds.

segment.source: This parameter lets you control the amount of time for the machine to rest before running the particular file operation for that iteration.
segment.target: This parameter lets you control the amount of time for the machine to rest before running the particular file operation for that iteration.

segment.source: Workload
segment.target: Workload

segment.source: Specifies which workloads to run.
segment.target: Specifies which workloads to run.

segment.source: Programmatic and Scripted Workloads are available.
segment.target: Programmatic and Scripted Workloads are available.

segment.source: By default, only Programmatic Workloads are run.
segment.target: By default, only Programmatic Workloads are run.

segment.source: For more information about the file functions performed by each workload, see Workloads.
segment.target: For more information about the file functions performed by each workload, see Workloads.

segment.source: Import data location
segment.target: Import data location

segment.source: Specifies the location of the files you want to use during the assessment.
segment.target: Specifies the location of the files you want to use during the assessment.

segment.source: When an import location is specified, the assessment copies the files from the Import data location to the Source folder.
segment.target: When an import location is specified, the assessment copies the files from the Import data location to the Source folder.

segment.source: During the assessment process, the source content is copied to the Destination folder.
segment.target: During the assessment process, the source content is copied to the Destination folder.

segment.source: For this reason, both the Source and Destination folders must be empty when the assessment starts.
segment.target: For this reason, both the Source and Destination folders must be empty when the assessment starts.

segment.source: Enable Minifilter Diagnostic Mode
segment.target: Enable Minifilter Diagnostic Mode

segment.source: Specifies whether to use the minifilter diagnostic option.
segment.target: Specifies whether to use the minifilter diagnostic option.

segment.source: By default, this check box is cleared.
segment.target: By default, this check box is cleared.

segment.source: When the minifilter diagnostic mode is enabled, it produces metrics that help you evaluate the effect of minifilters on file handling.
segment.target: When the minifilter diagnostic mode is enabled, it produces metrics that help you evaluate the effect of minifilters on file handling.

segment.source: For more information about this setting, see Minifilter Diagnostics.
segment.target: For more information about this setting, see Minifilter Diagnostics.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The minifilter diagnostic option is supported only on Windows 8.
segment.target: The minifilter diagnostic option is supported only on Windows 8.
